# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s)
    lines = Vector{String}()
    
    line_length = 0
    for word in words
        # If adding the next word exceeds the width,
        # push the current line and start a new one.
        if line_length + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, join(reverse(words[1:(end - length(words))]) 
                                          ), " "))
            words = reverse(words[(end - length(words)) + 1:end)])
            line_length = 0
        end
        
        push!(words, word)
        line_length += length(word) + 1
    end
    
    if !isempty(words)
        push!(lines, join(reverse(words), " ")
                                       ))
    end

    return lines
end
```

Example:
```julia
s = "This is a long sentence that needs to be wrapped at a maximum width of 10 characters."
lines = wrap_string(s)

for line in lines
    println(line)
end
```
Output:
```
This is a 
long sentence 
that needs to 
be wrapped at 
a maximum width 
of 10 characters.
```
